I‚Äôve voted for responsible plans that would‚Äòve repealed & replaced Obamacare - but always w/  replacement plans that protect those w/ pre-existing conditions, kids in school & Medicaid-expansion state recipients. We can‚Äôt just do away w/ the ACA w/ no replacement ready on day #1.

But the Constitution is clear that spending originates in the Congress. That‚Äôs why I voted to override the President‚Äôs veto. Using a national emergency and taking money without Congress‚Äô sign-off is an end-around and sets an unfortunate precedent. pic.twitter.com/NKyGbreMH2

I have been a strong supporter of funding for border security and the wall. I voted for the Secure Fence Act of 2006, and in the last two years alone, I have voted four times to provide funding for the border wall. pic.twitter.com/tALkpLEneG

I have supported billions of dollars for border security. The issue is whether the President can take money appropriated for one purpose & spend it for something else - without Congress' consent.

Every minute of every day these officers put their lives on the line. When you see a law enforcement official, be sure to thank them for their service. I share Chief Thomas‚Äô thoughts that we are grateful everyone is going home safely. https://upton.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=399154¬†‚Ä¶

I have been in contact with Kalamazoo Public Safety Chief Karianne Thomas and commended her team and all the first responders for their swift action at the scene. We are so grateful for the brave men and women who work to protect our families and our communities....

Today‚Äôs shooting reminds us of the incredible danger facing our law enforcement officials. I join our entire community in praying for a full recovery for the Kalamazoo officer who was shot, and our hearts are with their loved ones and all those who are impacted....

You can expect a strong, bipartisan, Michigan-led effort to once again protect every penny of the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative - and we will prevail.
